alert.note: Alert for King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:59PM EDT until July 25 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN...NORTHWESTERN RICHMOND... WESTMORELAND...EAST CENTRAL CAROLINE AND ESSEX COUNTIES... At 559 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Colonial Beach to Champlain to near Millers Tavern, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Tappahannock, Colonial Beach, Warsaw, Montross, Champlain, Saint Stephens Church, Newtown, Newland, Coles Point, Hague, Loretto, Leedstown, Beazley, Currioman Landing, Hustle, Elevon, Mount Holly, Biscoe, Stratford Hall, Lyells and Mount Landing. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
